page.title: 07Recreation in the Valley
page.content: East Dean has a football team which plays in league matches. Stoolball is still played but only friendly games. A Youth Club with a membership of 40 meets in the Village Hall every week. Gardening is recreation for a lot of people. The majority of villagers still grow their own vegetables and are very proud of their gardens. There are some allotments at East Dean which are rented from Goodwood Estate. Walking on the Downs is still a very popular form of recreation as is horse riding. The Mobile Library calls at both Charlton and East Dean and is well supported.
